title: 114_s1065
content: The "School Asthma Management Plan Act" is added to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, introducing school asthma management plans under Part D. The Secretary is authorized to award grants to local educational agencies to develop and implement school asthma management plans and purchase drugs and devices for emergency use for students. Grants may also be awarded to local health or education departments for the same purpose if deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary may award grants to local educational agencies or departments for developing and implementing school asthma management plans. Priority is given to agencies assisting schools with a high burden of asthma. Grant recipients must create comprehensive asthma management plans based on national guidelines. Schools receiving grants must develop and implement asthma management plans based on national guidelines. Plans should include identifying students with asthma, creating individual action plans, educating staff, providing access to medication, and emergency response training. The curr_chunk outlines the requirements for schools or departments receiving grants for asthma management, including providing medication based on individual needs, specific emergency policies, protocols for clinical management, coordination of care with family and providers, monitoring treatment quality, and completing the EPA's Indoor Air Quality Profile. Schools receiving grants for asthma management must utilize existing systems, find innovative ways to promote communication and treatment adherence, have trained staff for emergency asthma care, include asthma triggers in student action plans, and report asthma emergencies to the State health department. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2016 and beyond. The table of contents in the Act is amended to include authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2016 and beyond. The Act includes authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2016 and beyond, as well as a section on school asthma management plans.
